intro: Pilosella mollicaulis subsp. anoclada, commonly known as the slender pilosella, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are usually hairy and narrow, while the flowers are small and yellow, often forming a single head. It is a perennial herb that produces seeds through wind dispersal, contributing to its spread in suitable environments.
